titles.title: American River Pump Station Project Transfer Act of 2005
American River Pump Station Project Transfer Act of 2005
American River Pump Station Project Transfer Act of 2006
To direct the Secretary of the Interior to transfer ownership of the American River Pump Station Project, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water and Power.
Subcommittee on Water and Power Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 109-430.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 238.

action.text: Mr. Radanovich moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4204.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Water and Power. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 5/9/2006--Passed House amended. American River Pump Station Project Transfer Act of 2006 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to transfer ownership of the American River Pump Station Project located at Auburn, California, to the Placer County Water Agency. Makes federal costs associated with construction of the Project nonreimbursable. Authorizes the Secretary to grant title to the Agency to provide a water supply to that Agency. Requires the Secretary, before conveying such land and facilities, to comply with requirements under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, the Endangered Species Act of 1973, and any other applicable law. Provides that upon the transfer, the United States shall not be liable for damages relating to the land or facilities.
